titles.title: To amend the Defense Department Overseas Teachers Pay and Personnel Practices Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary and Vocational Education.

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 103-598, Part I.
Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn without amendment. With written report No. 103-396.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 709.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate.
Amendment SP 2650 proposed by Senator Breaux for Senator Levin.
Amendment SP 2650 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. McCloskey asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 10/7/1994--Passed Senate amended. Amends the Defense Department Overseas Teachers Pay and Personnel Practices Act to require the Director of Dependents' Education to establish for such teachers a voluntary leave transfer program. Authorizes the Director to establish a leave bank program for such teachers. Authorizes three additional days of leave for such teachers who are employed in a supervisory position or higher. Amends Federal civil service law to prohibit cash awards to: (1) certain politically appointed Federal officers for a certain period during a Presidential election year; and (2) Executive Schedule officers.
